alert.note: Alert for Southern Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 2:47PM MDT until March 20 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 6 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. For the second Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 15 to 30 inches with locally higher amounts across Brian Head and the Tushars. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph Tuesday night and Wednesday. * WHERE...Southern Mountains. * WHEN...For the first Winter Storm Warning, until 9 PM MDT this evening. For the second Winter Storm Warning, from 6 AM Tuesday to 6 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
